---
aliases:

author: Matthew Hamilton
date: "2021-02-24"
description: ready4 toolkits.
title: Toolkits
---

The four categories of ready4 toolkits are:

 - [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/ready4-authoring-maroon?style=flat&labelColor=black&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](../tags/authoring-toolkits) toolkits to help standardise and automate common code authoring and data management tasks;
  - [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/ready4-description-navy?style=flat&labelColor=black&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](../tags/description-toolkits) toolkits to help standardise and automate the description and pre-processing of specific types of input datasets;
 - [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/ready4-modelling-indigo?style=flat&labelColor=black&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](../tags/modelling-toolkits) toolkits to help standardise and automate common mental health modelling tasks; and
 - [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/ready4-prediction-forestgreen?style=flat&labelColor=black&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](../tags/prediction-toolkits) toolkits to help forecast population mental health outcomes under varying potential future states.

A number of the toolkits have been documented in a basic fashion by an algorithm we created as part of the [ready4fun](../post/ready4fun-bare-bones/) package (human written edits and extensions to this documentation will be produced later in 2021) - and source code for these toolkits are now  publicly available  in our [GitHub repositories](https://github.com/ready4-dev). A further set of toolkits are in the process of being documented and will be publicly released later in 2021.
